    <title>Ajmal Masroor:  Deafening Silence and the Intolerable Hypocrisy by Liberals and Intellectuals</title>

        <name>Ajmal Masroor</name>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I'm becoming impassive to the inconsistent and selective mantra chanting of Western liberals calling for human rights, rule of law and democracy.  They seem to be quick to condemn human rights abuse in certain situations but in others, especially those involving Muslims, they remain curiously silent.

    <title>Umar Nasser:  Young British Muslims Need to Disinherit Anti-Ahmadi Prejudice. Here's How.</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/umar-nasser/ahmadi-muslims_b_9656806.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/umar-nasser/ahmadi-muslims_b_9656806.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-11T15:57:34Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-11T10:57:36Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Umar Nasser</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/umar-nasser/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Personally, I have little hope for the older generation of Muslims who have inherited over a century of anti-Ahmadi propaganda. Rather, it is my generation I have some hope for. With the knowledge available from the internet and the increased visibility of Ahmadis in society, perhaps they can look past the myopia of many of their forefathers.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/ahmadiyya">Ahmadiyya</a>, <a href="/tag/ahmadiyya-muslim-community">Ahmadiyya Muslim Community</a>, <a href="/tag/muslims">Muslims</a>, <a href="/tag/asad-shah">Asad Shah</a>, <a href="/tag/islam">Islam</a>, <a href="/tag/blasphemy-laws">Blasphemy Laws</a>,  <a href="/uk-universities-education">UK Universities & Education News</a></p>

    <title>Sahib Ullah-Raj:  I've Witnessed Radicalisation and I'm Taking Action</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/sahib-ullahraj/radicalisation-young-muslims_b_9635006.html" />

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        People like me, a Muslim boy who felt FGM was not my concern, are slowly waking up to the fact that FGM is everybody's business.  Grooming is also everybody's business. Radicalisation is also abuse, and it is everybody's business. And because it is everybody's business, it is our duty to fight it - and to protect vulnerable young people.

    <title>Shohana Khan:  If Muslim Women's Clothing Makes Them Consenting Slaves, who are Their Slave Masters?</title>

    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        So I have a final plea to such individuals - if we, Muslim women, decide to continue with our self-inflicted slavery, would you at least please let us be? As the only individuals trying to tug the chains on our supposed shackled necks it seems, has been you.

    <title>Angeli Bhandal:  The Media Needs to Bring People Together in the Face of Terrorism, Not Drive Them Apart</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/brussels_b_9615438.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/brussels_b_9615438.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-05T06:20:16Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-05T09:43:00Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Angeli Bhandal</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Instead of worrying about the spread of ISIS, we need more uplifting spirits. We must remember that we are the majority. Individually we may not be able to do a lot, but collectively we have the power to make a difference. It is up to us to filter through the sea of fear-mongering and ignorance and make a stand for the oppressed, regardless of race or gender.

	    </content>
